I can't quite believe I am writing this but after 9 wonderful years the time has come to sell my beloved 1966 VW 11 Window Splitscreen.

The bus was first registered in Sweden in 1966 and imported into the UK in March 2005. I purchased the bus in June 2007.

Over the last 9 years I have sympathetically upgraded the bus whilst maintaining a lot of its original characteristics, resulting in a bus that looks very classic in appearance but underneath has been significantly upgraded. It really is a lovely example and very practical.

It is a very solid and straight bus (see pics) and over the years no expense has been spared upgrading and maintaining it. I have invested over £18,000 during my ownership (with over £16,000 in receipts).

Overview of the specification:-

Mechanical

- 2007cc Engine (1776 case with 78mm Crank and 90.5 Barrel & Piston)
- Engle 110 Camshaft
- Dual Weber 40 IDF Carbs
- Pertronix Electronic Ignition with Flamethrower Coil and Ignition Leads
- Stainless Steel 4 into 1 High Performance Exhaust wth J tubes
- Straight Axle Conversion (Bus Boys with Beetle Gearbox)
- Front Beam with Foxsy adjuster
- SCAT large reinforced oil sump
- CSP Front Disc Brakes Conversion
- King Pins replaced
- Fully reconditioned steering box
- Bespoke Towbar

Interior

- Full camping interior (originally from Busfurniture.co.uk) made from high grade marine ply
- Includes table and converts to full length bed
- Side unit includes 2 ring cooker with grill and single sink
- Upholstery by Trimming Tonic
- High grade ply roof
- Rear roof locker/shelf
- 2 x Rear Pop-out Windows
- 3 point Front Seat Belts
- Entire floor and over engine bay covered in DYNAMAT (best sound deadener on the market) significantly reducing engine noise, and improving performance of entertainment system

Full Entertainment System

- Alpine iPod compatible head unit
- Alpine drop down TV / DVD player
- Alpine TV Tuner
- Infinity speaker system including Front Door speakers, Rear speakers and Subwoofer
- Full split charging system in engine compartment

Chassis/Bodywork

- In the last year I have had the outer and inner sills replaced on both sides, and resprayed.
- Prior to that back in 2008 I had the chassis/fully fully checked with some sections being completely replaced or repaired (including cab floor, centre chassis section and an outrigger)
- The bodywork is not concours but is good with no corrosion, as I've always had things sorted as they come up.


As you can see an impressive spec. All mechanical work has been carried out by local Classic VW Specialists who have spent their entire lives working on these beautiful things. All work has been completed to a high standard. The engine alone cost almost £5,000 and gives a fantastic drive with power readily available when you need it. The bus will happily cruise at 75mph and with its power has good acceleration even on uphill stretches.

Overall genuinely a lovely bus that will give the new owner lots of fun, and create lots of fantastic memories. It's not a concours and I'm not selling as this - it needs a home where it will be used and enjoyed. It's also a real headturner because whilst it isn't 'stock' it has all those classic features that make the original buses so distinctive.

Full MOT until May 2017.

£32,500 ovno.

If you have any questions or would like to arrange a viewing please contact me.

But please NO TIMEWASTERS - I know what the bus is worth and won't be letting it go on the cheap!!


Thank you for reading.
